Key Match Events: South Africa and Zimbabwe have been left with a point each after their T20 World Cup game in Hobart could not be completed due to rain.
When heavier rain forced an end to the game, South Africa was 0-51 off three overs chasing 64 to win.
Zimbabwe quick Richard Ngarava limped from the field with an ankle injury after slipping in his follow-through in the wet conditions.
The match was declared a no-result, with the teams splitting the points.
South Africa opener Quinton de Kock smashed a blistering 47 from 18 balls to almost get his team across the line.
Zimbabwe earlier posted 5-79 from a reduced nine overs, after showers pushed back the start of play.
Zimbabwe did well to recover from 4-19 in the fourth over on the back of an unbeaten 18-ball 35 from Wessly Madhevere.
Post-Match Reflections: Zimbabwe coach David Houghton criticised the call to try to play on as bowler Richard Ngarava was injured after slipping over.
Houghton said the rain was so heavy that play should have been stopped before Zimbabwe even bowled a ball.
South Africa coach Mark Boucher said the conditions were tough but teams had to live with the decisions of the officials.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The result leaves South Africa one point behind India and Bangladesh after the opening round, with only two countries progressing to the semi-finals.
